greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of permutations of {1..n} with n inversions.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1665
formula: a(n) = A008302(n,n) = coefficient of q^n in the q-factorial of n.
a(n) = T(n,n) with T(n,k) = T(n-1,k) + Sum_{j=1..n-1} T(n-1,k-j) for n>=0, k>0; T(n,k) = 0 for n<0; T(n,0) = 1 for n>=0. - _Alois P. Heinz_, Mar 07 2013
maple: a:= n-> coeff(series(mul((1-q^j)/(1-q), j=1..n), q, n+1), q, n):
mathematica: Table[SeriesCoefficient[QPochhammer[x, x, n]/(1-x)^n, {x, 0, n}], {n, 0, 25}] (* _Vaclav Kotesovec_, May 13 2016 *)
results.author: _Paul D. Hanna_, Mar 12 2007
